content.description: The crux is either the first 10ft or the last 5ft. Heading right at the top is slightly easier. Going straight up at the top is doable but the key crimpers need to be cleaned and it is considerably harder then 10d.
content.protection: 2 bolts, Small to .5 (C3's recommended). Alternatively this can be top roped.
content.location: East face, just left of the gully that takes you to the top.

content.description: Slightly vertical for the grade, but with very nice holds for most of the climb. The crux is probably coming over the top.
content.protection: Can be top roped from top of crag. Run a line from main 1" crack at top of the crag over small gully.
content.location: North (downhill) side of crag. Crack just to the right of Oxidation, near the middle of the wall on this side.

content.description:
This route starts with a short scramble up onto a large ledge where the real climbing starts. Pull an undercling followed by 3 lunges to large flat holds. Scramble over the top and you're done.

This route would be rated higher if it were clean, as of now all holds are quite over grown with lichen and hard to grab.
content.protection: Must be top roped from top of crag. Run a line from main 1" crack at top of the crag over small gully.
content.location: North (downhill) side of crag. Left most route on north face.

content.description: The crux is getting over the small roof. However, getting to the roof isn't trivial either. The route eases up considerably after the roof.
content.protection: This route could be climbed with trad but would require some runs and not so good placements. Recommended that you top rope this with anchors from Battle Crack.
content.location:
Just right of

Battle Crack

. On the west side of the crag.

content.description: Climb past a single bolt and continue up into a thin crack to finish.
content.location:
Just right of

Castle Grey Skull

on a separate face.

content.description: This is the wide crack splitting the south face of the formation - solo or toprope.
content.location:
Located between

Retarded Arete

and the left side of the

Castle Grey Skull

slab.

content.description: In order to maintain the grade you must stay on the face and not wander onto the very tempting looking corner to your right. Fairly sustained for the first 30', with the crux maybe being 15' up.
content.protection: 1 bolt has been placed near the start, but nothing higher up and no place for trad. For now top roping this route is recommended.
content.location:
Right of

Castle Grey Skull

, just left of the right corner of the south face.

content.description: The crux is probably about 15' up. Pretty sustained for the first 20-25'. Good hand crack the whole way, but the angle and lack of left foothold give this route it's challenge. Transverse left with the crack about halfway up and follow all the way to the top.
content.protection: .3-2" (double on 1" and 2" if you have them and like putting in lots of cams)
content.location: Anchor short of the top with 1-2" or use slings/webbing to run anchor from long 1" crack on the top of the crag. This crack can be used to anchor nearly all the routes on this crag.

content.description:
Start straight up the face, crux is getting the first bolt. Alternatively: 1) climb up the rocks to the right until you can climb the first bolt and then transverse onto the face, or 2) use the boulder behind to create a "chimney" and work your way up until you can transfer onto the face at the first bolt.

Beyond the first bolt the route is 5.6-7. Recommended that you past the anchors and finish up over the top of the crag if you have a way to anchor at the top.
content.location:
South face of Castle Grey Skull. Around the corner from

Catholic Grade School

.

content.description: Fairly sustained 5.9 with the crux probably being about 10' up. Start left and then work up and right with the crack.
content.protection: Pro .5 - 2", save a couple cams in the .3 range for anchors.
content.location: Farthest left route on the west face.

climbs.name: [Redacted]
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett, Brandt Allen and Laurel Colella, August 2000

content.description: Climbs the arÃªte with gear placements when needed and no bolts.
content.location:
The next route right of

Catholic Grade School

.
